trans-unit.source: Error: "A SceneCameraRenderer in use has no camera assigned to its Slot. Make sure a camera is enabled and assigned to the Slot."
trans-unit.target: Error: "A SceneCameraRenderer in use has no camera assigned to its Slot. Make sure a camera is enabled and assigned to the Slot."

trans-unit.source: !Note In earlier versions of Stride, this error message was: "A SceneCameraRenderer in use has no camera set. Make sure the camera component to use is enabled and has its Slot property correctly set."
trans-unit.target: !Note In earlier versions of Stride, this error message was: "A SceneCameraRenderer in use has no camera set. Make sure the camera component to use is enabled and has its Slot property correctly set."

trans-unit.source: This error means there's no camera available for the scene renderer to use. This has several possible causes:
trans-unit.target: This error means there's no camera available for the scene renderer to use. This has several possible causes:

trans-unit.source: the camera is set to the wrong camera slot
trans-unit.target: the camera is set to the wrong camera slot

trans-unit.source: there are multiple enabled cameras assigned to the same camera slot
trans-unit.target: there are multiple enabled cameras assigned to the same camera slot

trans-unit.source: If you create your camera components in Game Studio, make sure:
trans-unit.target: If you create your camera components in Game Studio, make sure:

trans-unit.source: the camera slots are set to the Main slot (see Graphics — Camera slots)
trans-unit.target: the camera slots are set to the Main slot (see Graphics — Camera slots)

trans-unit.source: only the initial camera is enabled
trans-unit.target: only the initial camera is enabled

trans-unit.source: If you create your camera components in code, make sure you retrieve the correct slot from the graphics compositor. Use:
trans-unit.target: If you create your camera components in code, make sure you retrieve the correct slot from the graphics compositor. Use:

trans-unit.source: To change the camera at runtime, toggle the Enabled property.
trans-unit.target: To change the camera at runtime, toggle the Enabled property.

trans-unit.source: always have at least one enabled camera
trans-unit.target: always have at least one enabled camera

trans-unit.source: don't have multiple cameras enabled and assigned to the same slot at the same time
trans-unit.target: don't have multiple cameras enabled and assigned to the same slot at the same time
